website_summaries.verdict: By far the best deal for mothers on a budget – it's half the price of others on our list but doesn't lack quality.
pros: Stands out for its compelling features – back support, arm rests, and side pocket provides comfort and convenience
cons: Users found that the wrap-around design doesn't fit larger moms very well, and the material is somewhat firm

customer_reviews.title: Horrible purchase. I don’t understand the hype...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand why so many people swear by this thing. My son could not get comfortable when laying on this because of the awkward raised parts where he would lay his head. And it is such stiff material. He would literally scream whenever I would use this. Whether I say normally or Indian-style, I still found myself having to hunch over - so the wrap around back support was pointless. You’re better off with the boppy or even just a simple pillow!! $40 down the toilet!!
customer_reviews.author: Grant J

customer_reviews.title: ***TOXIC***
customer_reviews.text: After much sadness I decided to return after during massive research on this pillow (which started with car seat, play yards, strollers etc). May not use flame retardant but they use polyurethane foam which is highly toxic when inhaled causing a multitude of issues and guess what our babies do but sit and inhale. I’m disgusted and sad that I ever used this in the first place. Avoid at all costs. Boppy might be a pain sometimes but worth it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Best pillow for me, but... several buts
customer_reviews.text: I want to review higher because this pillow has worked better for me than any of the other more popular ones, BUT -Not waterproof -Cover is rough fabric -Cover can’t be used in the dryer... so had to buy a second for back up -Still hurt lower abdomen after cesarean. Football hold worked best, but you lose some support from pillow. Had to prop up another pillow under it -When removing the super tight cover, a piece of foam came off in my hand 🤦🏼‍♀️ Despite all of that... it is still my pillow of choice for each feeding session.
customer_reviews.author: Dayne Whitehurst

customer_reviews.title: My favorite breastfeeding accessory!
customer_reviews.text: I used a Boppy with my first child in 2013, but didn't use it much. I'm plus sized (18-20) and found it didn't sit around my waist well and my son would kind of slide into the gap between the pillow and my body. I haven't had either of those issues with the My Brest Friend. The buckle keeps in snug to my waist and makes it feel very secure. It's also very easy to release one handed. The pillow portion is firm, but soft, so it's very supportive for my newborn without feeling too hard. The cover is very easy to unzip to wash and super easy to get back on. This is my favorite breastfeeding accessory!
customer_reviews.author: AC Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I’d had this with my first baby!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 year old and a 2 month old. I used a Boppy with my older son. It worked fine, but I was always rearranging and adjusting. Now that I’ve had another, I saw this pillow advertised and decided to try it. Wow! This one is so much better!! The fact that it goes all the way around and snaps makes it so that it doesn’t slip down. The pocket on the front is super helpful because I use an app to clock nursing time. I was constantly losing it with the other pillow. Now I know exactly where it is! I’m a plus size and this pillow adjusted to fit me very easily!
customer_reviews.author: Redjess81

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would need a breastfeeding pillow. I thought it was just another unnecessary accessory in the lucrative world of baby stuff. Boy I was wrong. After a miserably uncomfortable week of using several pillows that would just smush down, and practically pushed my husband out of the bed everytime I had a night feeding, I gave up and bought this. So glad! My belly was really tender after giving birth and I hadn't realized how much the baby's weight made me uncomfortable. This improved that so much and took away the need for extra pillows. Baby is 8 weeks now and I'm still using it; I think he will fit for several more weeks.
customer_reviews.author: meg

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl is due in July, so I haven’t been able to fully use it yet, but I have wrapped it around myself. I LOVE this thing! It has so much more support than a boppy, which is what I used with my daughter and didn’t work well at all. Love that it wraps around the back for some back support, it’s adjustable, and has a pouch to put things in. Love it so far and have a feeling it’ll be so comfortable to breastfeed my daughter with in July!
customer_reviews.author: Jen T

customer_reviews.title: Holy fudge
customer_reviews.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! This thing is INCREDIBLE! I have both a regular boppy and one of those boppys without a holw in the middle and both were fine. But, when I saw that there was something that supported your back I jumped so fast to buy it. (Not literally. I sat in bed with my baby and online shopped) I'm using it for the first time right now and had to leave this review! It helps my back so much and allows me to be hands free which is UH MAZING! Totally buy this! Yes!
customer_reviews.author: Lilyboo666

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow, my baby is 3 months and i wish i would have purchased this sooner. She falls asleep on it after nursing everytime. Its very comfortable to use. The only thing i dont like is that the inside foam is exposed when you take the cover off to wash. Makes the pillow appear cheap. For the price, i just wish it had an inside pillow case or something. But thats probably how they sell the slip covers i suppose. Its too expensive for what it is, but it makes breastfeeding easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best nursing pillow ever!!!! I was having trouble latching with my newborn but after going to the lactation consultant and trying out the pillow and truly putting it to the test there abd then getting one for myself it has truly helped and made the process easier. This has truly given me the confidence and help I needed at home and wherever (because I carry it atound at times) to feed my baby better and with less pain on me.
customer_reviews.author: Flor Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Prefer Over Boppy
customer_reviews.text: This was very useful as the clips/straps helped keep the pillow stuck to me even if i wanted to walk around. I preferred over the Boppy since my newborn could not slip off the pillow as easily. Cover is washable. One con is that the cover can be hard to put back on if not done correctly (the pillow is some sort of styrophome). Also, only useful in the first 3 months (4 months if your baby is on the smaller side). Boppy can be used for tummy time etc. after the fact. It was recommended to me by a lactation consultant.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: smells, fades after one wash
customer_reviews.text: right out of the box this brest friend gave off a chemical smell. i didn’t think it was a big deal so i just put it through the wash and was pretty excited to use it until i took it out of the dryer and noticed the color faded so much it looked like i had laid it out in the sun for a year (picture of the faded fabric attached) also the foam inside still has this chemical moldy smell like its been stored in a musty warehouse for a while. i can’t return this because i already threw away the packaging but what a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Hollykay

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Other Breastfeeding Pillows
customer_reviews.text: I like this pillow a heck of a lot more than the other popular brand of breastfeeding support pillow. I have both, and this one doesn't slip out from under my arm while nursing. The pocket on the front is an added bonus to hold my phone. It also extends enough to fit plus sizes, something I think other pillows can't accommodate. The back support piece is fabulous, and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great for c section moms and all others!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pillow for nursing! I can nurse for a long time with this pillow since Baby just lays on it and I don’t have to hold her. I used a boppy pillow for my first child and hated it, 4 kids later wanted to try this pillow based off the positive reviews. I wish I would have gotten it sooner. Great pillow, sturdy, and stays in place. I had a c section and this helped with not having to put Baby on my stomach, great purchase, no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of wasting money on this when I already had a great pillow. Other moms I know who've tried it have had similar problems I found with this, mostly it's uncomfortable! The pillow is not very thick, I was never able to use it without being hunched over badly. The back support piece is a nice idea, but I didn't benefit from it while having to lean over so much. Overall I've tried to use it a few times and it's ultimately lived the rest of its life stored away, unused. I recommend the Babe Au Lait nursing pillow instead!
customer_reviews.author: s.black

customer_reviews.title: Love this breastfeeding pillow!
customer_reviews.text: So glad someone told me about this breast feeding pillow. I struggled with the Boppy for a few weeks after giving birth and purchased this after a friend suggested it. It made such a huge difference in supporting my baby and keeping him in one spot in order to maintain a good latch. The cover easily comes off to wash it, the foam base is sturdy, the clasp is quiet for not waking up a sleeping baby if they fall asleep on it, and the little pouch is great for keeping chapstick, nipple cream, etc. Loved this pillow so much I purchased the inflatable version for when we’re traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfectly designed. Unlike the boppy, this pillow has a firm and defined shape, so your baby won’t sink into it. This gives you a ton of control in positioning. I love that you can clasp it around the waist too - I clip mine on at my natural waist and it “floats” above my lap at the perfect height. SO much easier than trying to arrange pillows and/or squishy nursing pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this pillow
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow! Originally I was a little skeptical because I didn’t recognize the brand name (sometimes you can’t trust other brand products) like the Boppy but I took a chance and I’m so glad I did. I used a Boppy for my son while breastfeeding and I always felt as if he would roll down when I fed him. Since this pillow is flat, you don’t have that issue. It’s easy to get comfortable and situate the baby into a position when she remains while feeding. The back strap really does provide back support while feeding and helps you to keep your posture while feeding i stead of slumping over.
customer_reviews.author: Lynsey Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Great for nursing! Comfort and support!
customer_reviews.text: Love this for newborn nursing. I had another pillow, which is fine for holding my baby, but when nursing a lactation consultant had me supporting that pillow and myself with two to three additional pillows! They would slip and move and as everything slipped my positioning, and in turn my baby's latch, would slip. I love that it clips so if I move to the table to eat, I just have to hold my baby, instead of my baby and the pillow. Big thumbs up, fit my need.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for you and your baby!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a life-changer! I had such a hard time nursing using regular pillows and a nursing pillow I already had. My son would either sink or roll away, but with this product I could easily get him positioned right. It also was SO much more comfortable. I didn't feel like my back was aching and it helped me sit up properly. If you're having trouble, try this!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I’m not going to lie. I bought this and I got a boppy as a gift and I love it because of all the SUPER CUTE covers you could buy for it. I used the boppy more in the beginning thinking I liked it best because it was so cute. But the boppy would move around or baby would slowly fall between me and the boppy pillow. So I started using this. This was a game changer for me! It goes around your entire torso and buckles! How genius. Made nursing much more comfortable! Plus it supports your back more! So glad I bought this and ended up trying it out.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this off my registry because a good majority of the reviews said it was a must have. For me, I really could've done without. And I did. I tried using it a few times with my newborn but it was so much extra work to strap it on and adjust it to an angle to have her on it, most of the time I just used a regular pillow to prop her up. I understand everyone is different but for me this was not a necessity. Ended up selling it to our second hand baby store up the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: Awkward!
customer_reviews.text: Awkward! This was awkward for me just like the Boppy and similar breastfeeding pillows were for me. A regular king sized pillow always worked best for me. This was my first child and never having breastfed, the whole thing was awkward enough for me. I had to have someone help me strap myself into this thing while the baby was screaming. It was weird, like putting him up on a table and I was always afraid he would roll off. Ended up having to trade it in for much less than I paid for it. Don't get sucked in by the advertising. Some baby conveniences are worth it but this is one that can definitely be done without.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the U shaped pillow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the inventor of this breastfeeding pillow; finally no more back and neck pain. As I’m typing this I’m breastfeeding my newborn son. His latch is perfect and he seems comfortable and so am I! The design allows you to strap the pillow on your torso so your hands are free to pick up your baby. It can also sit right below your breasts so you won’t have to lean over for a good latch! Finally something that makes sense and works for the sole purpose of breastfeeding. Save your boppy as an extra support or a lounge chair for your baby!
customer_reviews.author: Rebs

customer_reviews.title: Better than Boppy, especially post c-section
customer_reviews.text: I’m SO MAD no one in the hospital recommended this after my c-section! It would have helped so much. Instead, I struggled for two months with a Boppy - which wouldn’t stay put, wasn’t high enough, and didn’t keep baby from kicking/punching my incision. The buckle & wraparound design make this pillow much more secure & high up on your abdomen, which promotes a better latch. The Boppy is useful for propping baby up and comes in cuter designs, but the My Brest Friend is vastly superior as a nursing pillow. Do yourself a favor and get one early on. :)
customer_reviews.author: CJP

customer_reviews.title: Ok - but awkward to attach
customer_reviews.text: Pros - The foam really does keep its form over time (I've had mine for ~4 months now), unlike the Boppy that squish down Cons - The attach-around-the-back design is annoying because it is one more time-consuming step when you have a crying, hungry newborn to feed in the middle of the night. It also doesn't solve the problem of getting the baby at the right height. I'm not particularly tall, but I need a small pillow underneath this to get the baby at breast height without me having to hunch over. In fairness, I haven't seen a breastfeeding pillow that solves this problem.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sanitary
customer_reviews.text: I decided to update my review now that my son is 3 months old and I've had a chance to use it. Cover is thin and the pillow is foam, your baby will spit up on it, milk will spill and quickly soak into the foam pillow, you can not wash the pillow, just the cover. I had a c-section and it was a little bulky to put on every two hours to nurse. I've used this a total of maybe 4 times. The two lumps for "head support" are uncomfortable on the baby's back and hips. I don't recommend this pillow, mostly for the sanitary reasons.
customer_reviews.author: NatG

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pillow just days before giving birth to my baby girl, but I had been contemplating whether or not I needed another specialized pillow. After using it for just a couple days, I already prefer this over my boppy! The added back support is nice and I love the clip on the side so you can literally wear this pillow around the house. The little built-in pocket is so nice for things you want in reach like snacks, nursing pads, burp rags, etc. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani H

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for plus-sized women
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pillow; unfortunately, it does not fit around my body. Initially, I was pretty upset about this but I have learned to adapt and the pillow provides an enormous amount of support. I also love the 2 bumps on the pillow. I'm able to either rest my baby's head on the bump or use it as wrist support when I'm holding the baby's head. Again, this pillow would have received 5 stars if they had a plus-size version. Furthermore, the black and white cover faded significantly after the first wash. I've washed it about 20 times over the past 8 weeks and it has not faded more after the first wash. Overall, I'm thrilled with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Pilt

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have both a Boppy breastfeeding pillow and the Brest Friend nursing pillow. Of the two I use the Brest Friend pillow far more often. It gives great support and has small extras (a pocket for a burp cloth or nipple cream or whatever else you might need handy). The Brest Friend also has some low back support which is so helpful. My only concern was if it would fit around me. I’m a size 22 before birth and it fit with room to spare. I’d absolutely recommend this pillow to anyone hoping to breastfeed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Boppy!
customer_reviews.text: As a second time mom, I wonder why I was not introduced to these the first time. Soooo much better than a Boppy pillow. These are a firm foam as reviewed earlier but that is the good part! Your baby won’t sink into the pillow like a Boppy! This is my second Brest Friend. I keep one in my car for feeding emergencies and the other at home. My husband uses it when he’s on baby duty for support. It has so many uses! Would highly highly recommend. My kid does great on it and the slip cover is super easy to wash. Cold, hang dry, put it back on and you’re good to go!
customer_reviews.author: H.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good when on sale
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving this three stars because it’s an unfinished product! They’ve been in business for over 20 years according to them and the best they can do is slap glue foam together and not even make it look good?! I was so scared of breaking the foam when I had to put the cover back on after washing it! This is a good idea poorly executed I’m disappointed because these cost just as much as boppy! I am hoping this holds up for a year I’ll be sure to update periodically!
customer_reviews.author: sachet

customer_reviews.title: Allows to me walk around with a free hand
customer_reviews.text: Best baby item purchase so far! My infant insists on being walked around when nursing, and this pillow has been a life saver. Instead of having to carry her weight for 20 minutes, she lays on the pillow and I just support her head/back. It gives me the ability to free an arm to be able to do things around the house. This is so much better than boppy pillows that get away from you. The only thing I’d like better is if the strap was Velcro instead of buckled, because the thinner end sometimes slips up or down and has to be adjusted while I’m walking around.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable strap is what sold me on getting this versus the boppy. I'm a FTM and I asked around and read reviews. It's nicely structured with a foam inside. Cover is machine washable. It fits to you and you don't have to worry about it shifting and readjusting while you're feeding your little one. The back support is nice as well. It keeps you from slouching to help position your baby correctly. Just a tip: you'll still need to put a small pillow or folded blanket underneath to make sure your baby is at the proper height to breast. But who doesn't have an extra cushion to spare?
customer_reviews.author: RAF

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for nursing. Defiantly helped a lot. I don’t know if after a certain age you could still use it. It become small for my baby after 2 months. Also the cover is really difficult to put on. I wash it often and it is so difficult to put the cover back on after. Very sturdy. Keeps you back straight and posture right during feeding. Defiantly must have. Buy it if you are pregnant and take it to hospital with you. So when you getting training for breast Feeidng you can have them help you with this. It helped a lot for me.
customer_reviews.author: mashal

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Forget the Boppy! Get this nursing pillow instead. I couldn’t get the latch correct so decided to give this pillow a try. It revolutionized breast-feeding for me. I will not use anything else going forward. Would highly recommend! Love that it has a pocket on the front to stash my phone and remotes for easy access. I love that I can use it for a cross cradle position or for the football hold. Love the back support. Love that it’s a firm support, and that the baby doesn’t roll.
customer_reviews.author: Blair K. Lindler

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting the worst neck, shoulder & back pain from nursing, my baby even seemed like she couldn't get comfortable sometimes. I would try using pillows to prop her up but she would just sink into them. This was exactly what we needed. It instantly gave me relief from my neck & back pain & my baby seemed way more comfortable & is nursing longer. It has the perfect firmness, height, & support. Wish I wouldn't have been sceptical & would have just bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons but way better than Boppy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a love hate relationship with this pillow. I was having breastfeeding problems and this pillow really helped me get comfortable. Wayyy better than the boppy which is a terrible pillow and doesn’t fit the postpartum body. This pillow is way better. But it feels a bit like a chore to get it on and off especially if you have an indecisive eater or a fussy baby. The clasp comes undone very easily which is annoying. Also my baby had acid reflux so I only used this for 6 weeks before I had to change positions (using no pillow) into an upright feeding position which made the reflux so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nice for newborns
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pillow when I met with a lactation consultant when our baby was a few days old.. she used one in her office and recommended it for us. We already had the boppy though so I couldn't justify getting another one. As she started getting bigger (about a month or so) I decided to try it. It wasn't as exciting as it was with the LC. It was too bulky and uncomfortable for a bigger baby. It made me appreciate our boppy pillow better. This is great for littles or newborns but did not love it as baby got bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Haley

customer_reviews.title: First time breast feeding moms need this
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this at the suggestion of a Lactation consultant. I was given a Boppy but it kept moving around and didn’t give me support. I ordered this two days after I came home with my newborn and it’s been worth every cent. It’s soft, has a pocket for snacks and phone, and it stays in place while baby nurses. She can fall asleep comfortably on it and I can set my phone right behind her on it and sit there comfortably for some time. I can stand up while wearing it and move to another room without disturbing baby if need be (obvious holding baby tightly on it). It’s been my BFF!
customer_reviews.author: StephB

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful.
customer_reviews.text: I have found this pillow to be quite useful during breastfeeding. Baby and I have struggled with finding a deep latch and the pillow helps her find a good enough one that I am not constantly in pain. I also like to use it as a resting place for baby once she inevitably drifts off to sleep after feeding. It's got a nice cushion and I know that she won't fall off. However, it's a piece of very expensive styrofoam with a zippered fabric, and that's disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Thurzday_Next

customer_reviews.title: Way better than boppy.
customer_reviews.text: I had a boppy for my other two children and I must admit this is way better it provides back support has storage compartments and it's a better surface for your child to nurse and sleep on. I wish I would have had this when I had a C-section I feel like it would have been amazing. I'm able to move around a little bit while having this attached as opposed to the boppy where it will slide if you just scoot over a little bit. I do wish I would have gotten the waterproof cover but since it was just as much as the pillow itself I chose not to.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow mommy

customer_reviews.title: Good pillow, good support
customer_reviews.text: Overall this pillow is fantastic. I like that it is firmer and flatter than the boppy so baby won’t slide off the edge, and I love the removable cover with pocket, however, make sure you allow several days to hang out side before you need to use it. The plastic smell out of the package is so strong I could feel my self gagging. Also I have no idea what the two bumps are for in the top. I assume to support babies head? No idea
customer_reviews.author: arctic granola cruncher

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the boppy pillow
customer_reviews.text: I originally had the boppy pillow and the baby would fall off, very uncomfortable to position the baby. My back was in horrible pain. I went to the pediatrician and they had one of these to use to nurse. I immediately fell in love and bought one. Love that it has a pocket where I can put in the remote, iPhone or water bottle. Comfortable to place baby on top and great for mother’s back!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the boppy
customer_reviews.text: I love this nursing pillow!! I was using the boppy lux nursing pillow for 3 months and came across this one and from the first use I love it. I no longer need to keep readjusting the pillow while nursing my baby, it stays in place and gives me that added back support. It even has an area to stick my snacks, nipple balm etc, I can even have my water bottle in there so everything is with me at all times. This was more affordable than the boppy and I'm way more impressed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Shazia Shah-Toledo

customer_reviews.title: The "Brest" nursing pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I have a BOPPY and while it does help, a lot of times my son slides in the middle of it. Not only that, but the BOPPY goes flat. I like My Brest Friend Nursing Pillow so much better. Not only does he not slide through it, but I can even get up and not interrupt him feeding because the strap keeps it snug against your body. You can even rest it on the counter or changing table if you need to. When my son falls asleep I can get up, rest it on the crib side and slowly transition him to the crib without waking him.
customer_reviews.author: I. Dorrington

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this for the first month of having a newborn. It’s nice to be able to have the pillow secured so that baby can stay nice and close for nursing. It is comfortable and easy to use. Once baby is a little bigger I prefer the flexibility of other nursing pillows, but I could see using this longer if you have a smaller baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT your brest friend
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great product, it’s supposed to support the lumbar while taking some pressure off your arms to feed your baby. The lumbar support doesn’t support it causes more back pain. Then when you have a baby who struggles to burp and you have to stand you are still wearing the pillow. It gets in the way. It really doesn’t bring my baby up high enough to breastfeed and I’m still supporting him with my arms. I found it easier to just hold my baby than to use this pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn L.

customer_reviews.title: Far superior to boppy
customer_reviews.text: Bobby is popular because of marketing. This product is where it’s at. It was a game changer for me when I purchased it for my two week old. He is now three months and 15 pounds and I still find myself attached to this nursing pillow. I can do other things while nursing like write this review!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hagle

customer_reviews.title: Save your back!!
customer_reviews.text: If you value your back, get this. It helps tremendously with breastfeeding and I prefer it over the free floating pillows. This thing clips around you and stays put, plus you can put it high around your waist or low below your belly button. The height adjustment is wonderful for comfort. The only downside is its flat, no incline for reflux, but I usually lean to one side then another to fix that. I love this thing. I call it "the ballerina" lol.
customer_reviews.author: D&N

customer_reviews.title: I would rather have the deluxe fleece version
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I liked the pattern. However, the fabric isn't very soft. I washed it (according to the directions) and it discolored. It even says on the tag it will discolor after washing. My sister has a solid fleece deluxe version and it's way softer and doesn't discolor after washing, so I would go with that. Other than the fabric softness and the discoloration, it's the same as the deluxe and will still do what you need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J.

customer_reviews.title: Best nursing pillow, just get it!
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend this nursing pillow enough. So much better than the Boppy! I used my first one for 21 months with my first child. I just replaced it now that my second child was born because cover was worn and pillow had split. Don't put the covers in the dryer. They can be tough to get back on and that's my only complaint. Good adjustable support. Great option for holding baby during naps too. Saves your arms if baby falls asleep during nursing and you don't want to disturb them.
customer_reviews.author: BandC928

product_meta.title: My Brest Friend Original Nursing Posture Pillow, Grey & Yellow Fireworks
product_meta.description:
Color:FireworksBreastfeeding can be one of the most challenging routines a new mother faces. Many women stop nursing due to trouble with latching, not knowing that proper positioning might make all the difference. A lot of new moms consult with lactation specialists only after becoming exasperated and exhausted, feeling they should instinctively know how to breastfeed their own baby, and not understanding why they’re having trouble. This My Brest Friend pillow is designed to give moms the confidence they need to feel secure and position them for breastfeeding success. My Brest Friend is here to help alleviate some of these stresses and demystify what many new mothers and fathers experience during those first precious months of your newborn baby’s life.
Enjoy The Support You’ve Been Looking For
Discover the solution in the Original Nursing Pillow. After years of thorough research and real-life testing, it is specifically designed to make breastfeeding more comfortable. Its supportive backrest encourages good posture during breastfeeding and prevents neck and shoulder strain, too. Also great at minimizing strain at the elbows and wrists, so you can focus all your attention on your little one.
Innovative Shape Keeps Baby Close
My Brest Friend boasts a unique shape and is the only pillow that fits snuggly against the wearer, eliminating the gap that most crescent-shaped nursing pillows have. This is especially important to facilitate proper latching for consistent feedings. Keep baby safe and sound and held securely in place on our firm and flat pillow throughout the entire nursing session.
Designed Just For You
Keep all your maternity supplies and accessories easily within reach in the super-convenient side pocket. Store extra bottles, nipple cream or even your smartphone to avoid getting up in the middle of nursing and disrupting baby.
Wrap around design provides welcome support to your weary back and sore shoulders. My Brest Friend Original Nursing Pillow surrounds your body for the ideal position for baby. Clever silent-release straps lets you slip away quietly when your newborn nods off and unlatches without waking the babe.
My Brest Friend strives to provide new mothers with the most intuitive and useful maternity products on the market. We are proud to be among the most preferred brands for lactation consultants and mothers alike and keep the comfort of mother and child at the forefront of everything we create.
Popular Positions for Nursing
Football: Mom puts her arm under her baby and supports them using her palm on their back and to support their head. Lay them down on a pillow next to you with their head at the end pointing down toward your feet, then put your arm underneath them and bring them up to your breast with their nose in line with the nipple, holding them similar to the way you would a football. Cradle: Your baby will be on its back horizontally and resting comfortably. If you’re feeding from the left breast, its head will rest in the crook of that same arm. The rest of your arm will be under the baby’s back and you’ll need to make sure that its spine, neck and head are fully supported while its nose is in line with the nipple from which they are feeding. Relax & Snuggle: Mom can lay on her side propped up with pillows behind her and the baby is laid on their side next to her at her breast, using the breastfeeding pillow to keep them in place. Bring your arm over your head to cradle your baby’s head and make sure it is properly placed at your breast as they feed.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The My Brest Friend nursing pillow is the perfect support pillow for proper latch-on and breastfeeding in comfort and security. The nursing pillow was developed in a laboratory of new moms, babies, and breastfeeding experts who set out to create a nursing pillow whose sole purpose was to answer all the needs of breastfeeding moms and babies.
feature_bullets: FEEL THE SUPPORT: Encourages better posture during breastfeeding, alleviating strain in your back, neck, and arms
FIRM AND FLAT: Prevents baby from rolling out of position during nursing
CONVENIENT POCKET: Handy pouch keeps your maternity supplies within easy reach
